720535f-a.text:
Hudson Street at West Houston (formerly Hammersley) Street, the N. W. corner seen from and including the cleared S. E. corner. part of the excavation for the new United States Appraisers Stores Building, which fills the entire block from Varick Street
to Hudson.
DDecember 7, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.
720535f-a.folder: Hudson Street & Houston Street (West), Manhattan, NY

724527f-a.text:
297 West Houston Street (formerly 102 Hammersley Street), one of a group of seven old houses with dormer windows on the south side of West Houston Street, west of Hudson Street.
In the background is shown the King Street side of the new Standard Statistics Building, Hudson Street from Charlton to King Streets.
July 16, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.
724527f-a.folder: Houston Street (West & Hudson Street, Manhattan, NY

720537f-a.text:
237 Year Old Land Gift of English Crown Sold to Builder
The site of this row of houses was part of the extensive farm in Greenwich Village which was given to Trinity Church by the British King in 1698. Trinity sold the property recently to Vivian Green, will erect a commercial structure on the block, which is the east side of Hudson Street from West Houston to Clarkson Street. William S. Sussman was the broker.
Jan. 6, 1935
720537f-a.folder: Hudson Street & Houston Street (West), Manhattan, NY

720534f-a.text:

clearing from West Houston Street.
Septeber 24th,1938
P.L.Sperr,

720534f-a.folder: Hudson Street & Houston Street (West), Manhattan, NY

720539f-a.text:
395 Hudson Street, west side, north from W. Houston (left) to Clarkson (right) Streets, as viewed northwestward across a clearance on the east side of Hudson Street. This loft building bears the street address as a name and is the property of the New York Central Railroad and forms a portion of their vast holdings in this vicinity. It was completed in June 1921. To the left margin is Houston Street Station of the Ninth Avenue "gg" which runs north and southward on Greenwich Street at this
point.
September 4, 1938.
P.L. Sperr
w0 wwPRTphIEPFIOP5.

724526f-a.text:
262 West Houston Street, north side, east of Hudson Street, adjoining Public School No. 95. This is a shack less than eight years old,
as shown.
June 15, 1930.

724526f-a.folder: Houston Street (West & Hudson Street, Manhattan, NY

724528f-a.text:
(1)
301, 297 to 281 West Houston Street, south side, west of, adjoining, and at Hudson Street, including the row of old houses with dormer windows which used to be 102 to 92 Hammersley Street, before 1858, when that street was absorbed by Houston Street,
losing its own name.
July 16, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
Rear view of 293 to 281 West Houston Street, two years earlier. At the right may be seen the rear of 371 Hudson Street, a fourstory tenement house in the middle of a block of much older
buildings.
April 23, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
